text: (born Miiko Shikata July 24, 1925 – January 2023) was an American actress. She is best known for co-starring with Marlon Brando as Hana-ogi in the 1957 movie Sayonara. She also worked with James Garner, Bob Hope, Cary Grant, and Toshirō Mifune (whom she also worked alongside of in the 1980 television miniseries, Shõgun). Taka was born in Seattle, Washington. She grew up in Los Angeles, California. Taka married Japanese-American actor Dale Ishimoto in Baltimore, Maryland, in 1944, and they had one son, Greg Shikata, who works in the film industry, and one daughter. They divorced in 1958. Taka's death, at the age of 97, was announced by her grandson on January 4, 2023. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1925 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from Seattle Category:Actors from Los Angeles
